meanings.sent1: She glugs her water after a long run.
meanings.sent2: He always glugs his soda when he's thirsty.
meanings.sent3: The toddler glugs down his milk, making his parents laugh.
meanings.sent4: The river glugs along, eager to reach the sea.
meanings.sent5: The horse glugs the water from the trough noisily.

meanings.definition: A sound made by liquid being poured from a container
meanings.sent1: The glugs of the pouring tea filled the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the glugs of the coffee being poured into the cup.
meanings.sent3: The glugs of the waterfall were soothing to the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The glugs of the rain hitting the roof made her sleepy.
meanings.sent5: The glugs of the fountain created a peaceful atmosphere in the garden.

meanings.definition: A quantity of liquid that is drunk in one swallow
meanings.sent1: She poured a glug of juice into her glass.
meanings.sent2: He took a glug of water before heading out for a run.
meanings.sent3: The cat lapped up the glug of milk left on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The lake seemed to take a glug of the sky during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The baby bird eagerly awaited its next glug of regurgitated food.
